snippet: A Federal appeals court has overturned five of seven felony convictions against a former powerful State Senator but has refused to order either a reduction of sentence or his immediate release from prison on bail.   The 52-year-old former lawmaker...
lead_paragraph: A Federal appeals court has overturned five of seven felony convictions against a former powerful State Senator but has refused to order either a reduction of sentence or his immediate release from prison on bail. The 52-year-old former lawmaker, Joseph Montoya, a Democrat from Whittier, had been a member of the Legislature for almost two decades in 1989, when he became the first California legislator in 35 years to be convicted of committing felonies while in office. In July 1990, he began serving a six-and-a-half-year Federal sentence for racketeering and extortion.

headline.main: 5 of 7 Convictions Overturned In California Politician's Case
